topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536bf89c63687208acf40100#post_536bf89c63687208acf40100
This. So much this.

Gail Simone's Wonder Woman books are some of my favorite comics. One of them involved her chucking a flaming helicopter at the fuck mothering DEVIL and then decapitating him with the invisible jet. It was the single most metal thing I've ever seen in any comic book.

Too bad her comics in New 52 are goddamn garbage.

I'm actually pretty disgusted with DC as a whole these days. The only New 52 books I follow are Animal Man and Swamp Thing.

Are there any Marvel books worth getting into right now? I follow Deadpool off and on already.

Dear diary next time a otaku asks me, "Can you tell me what this 'anime' is about?" I'm just going to show this instead:
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/154/139/3z0mR.gif!
And then walk away.  I can honestly feel Trashboat's pain here, cause for some reason most otakus only seem to know what naruto is.

topics.body:
Reading one of randomasour's links got me thinking.

What if the Universe as we know it has gone through the same process more than once? It explodes, it expands like a rubber band and the momentum returns to it's original point only to restart again.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

"Here's something that's not really obscure, But I liked it in SRW J":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XphjF-fHZkM
